result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Farron R. Dignin

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:29 p.m. 
Defendant appears via Zoom from MCJ, pro se;
Date and time set for a review hearing.

COURT questions Deft re: SPD.
Defendant makes statement re: employment status.
COURT directs Deft to contact SPD again to re-qualify since she most likely is not employed at this time.
COURT questions Deft re: prelim.
Defendant wishes to remove prelim at this time so she can get qualified for SPD. 
COURT finds good cause to toll time limits until next hearing. 

DATES:
Remove PH;
RH: 11/11/22 @ 1:00 p.m., 

Adjourned: 1:33 p.m.

Review hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 09:40 am.

No contact with victim(s): B.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

ADDRESS INFO for Farron R. Dignin
Current: 611 W. 6th Street, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2022)
Prior: 2301 W. Veterans PKWY #133, Marshfield, WI 54449

Case Called: 2:25 pm.
Clerk: Nicole.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant appears in custody from MCJ, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Julie Sawyer.

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

Updated Address: 611 W. 6th St. Neillsville, WI 54456.

BOND:  $1,000.00 cash bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): B.H.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PH: 11/9/22 @ 9:40 am in Branch 1.
PT: 12/7/22 @ 9:40 am in Branch 6.
RH: 11/4/22 @ 1:00 pm.

Adjourned: 2:32 pm.
